titleStmt.title: Proposalls from nine regiaments of horse, and seven regiaments of foot, for a modell of an agreement of the people for a firme and present peace, upon grounds of common-right and freedome. As it was proposed by the agents of the five regiaments of horse; to be offered to the joynt concurrence of all the free commons of England. And since adhered to by the generall approbation of the Army. Novemb. 4. 1647. Imprimatur G.M.

Proposalls from nine regiaments of horse, and seven regiaments of foot, for a modell of an agreement of the people for a firme and present peace, upon grounds of common-right and freedome. As it was proposed by the agents of the five regiaments of horse; to be offered to the joynt concurrence of all the free commons of England. And since adhered to by the generall approbation of the Army. Novemb. 4. 1647. Imprimatur G.M.

publicationStmt.publisher: First printed for the agitators, and use of the Army, and reprinted by Robert Ibbitson, in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the agitators, and use of the Army
